quote: Except our own thoughts, there is nothing absolutely in our power.
Parents wonder why the streams are bitter, when they themselves poison the fountain.
I count him braver who overcomes his desires than him who conquers his enemies, for the hardest victory is over self.
The more a thing tends to be permanent, the more it tends to be lifeless.
The soul is healed by being with children.
Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth.
Nihil est sine ratione. [There is nothing without a reason.]
Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something.
In all chaos there is a cosmos, in all disorder a secret order.
How vain it is to sit down to write when you have not stood up to live.
Perceptions which are at present insensible may grow some day: nothing is useless, and eternity provides great scope for change.
No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
There may be more beautiful times, but this one is ours.
Truly my opinion is, that all our opinions are alike vain and uncertain. what we approve today, we condemn tomorrow. Nature certainly never intended us for speculation.
All good things are wild and free.
It is unworthy of excellent men to lose hours like slaves in the labour of calculation which could safely be relegated to anyone else if machines were used.
Disobedience is the true foundation of liberty. The obedient must be slaves.

Is it so bad, then, to be misunderstood? Pythagoras was misunderstood, and Socrates, and Jesus, and Luther, and Copernicus, and Galileo, and Newton, and every pure and wise spirit that ever took flesh. To be great is to be misunderstood.
Whoever fights monsters should see to it that in the process he does not become a monster. And if you gaze long enough into an abyss, the abyss will gaze back into you.
The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
Man is condemned to be free; because once thrown into the world, he is responsible for everything he does. It is up to you to give [life] a meaning.
